org.fishwife.jrugged

Class CircuitBreaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fishwife.jrugged.CircuitBreaker
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MonitoredService, ServiceWrapper

    public class CircuitBreaker
extends Object
implements MonitoredService, ServiceWrapper
    A CircuitBreaker can be used with a service to throttle traffic to a failed subsystem (particularly one we might not be able to monitor, such as a peer system which must be accessed over the network). Service calls are wrapped by the CircuitBreaker.

    When everything is operating normally, the CircuitBreaker is CLOSED and the calls are allowed through.

    When a call fails, however, the CircuitBreaker "trips" and moves to an OPEN state. Client calls are not allowed through while the CircuitBreaker is OPEN.

    After a certain "cooldown" period, the CircuitBreaker will transition to a HALF_CLOSED state, where one call is allowed to go through as a test. If that call succeeds, the CircuitBreaker moves back to the CLOSED state; if it fails, it moves back to the OPEN state for another cooldown period.

    Sample usage: 

        public class Service implements Monitorable {
        private CircuitBreaker cb = new CircuitBreaker();
        public String doSomething(final Object arg) throws Exception {
        return cb.invoke(new Callable<String>() {
                                 public String call() {
                                     // make the call ...
                                 }
                             });
        }
        public Status getStatus() { return cb.getStatus(); }
    }

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected static class  CircuitBreaker.BreakerState
      Represents whether a CircuitBreaker is OPEN, HALF_CLOSED, or CLOSED.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean byPass
      Bypass this CircuitBreaker - used for testing, or other operational situations where verification of the Break might be required.
      protected List<CircuitBreakerNotificationCallback> cbNotifyList 
      protected CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception> exceptionMapper
      Helper class to allow throwing an application-specific exception rather than the default CircuitBreakerException.
      protected FailureInterpreter failureInterpreter
      The FailureInterpreter to use to determine whether a given failure should cause the breaker to trip.
      protected boolean isAttemptLive
      Whether the "test" attempt permitted in the HALF_CLOSED state is currently in-flight.
      protected AtomicLong lastFailure
      The time the breaker last tripped, in milliseconds since the epoch.
      protected String name
      The name for the CircuitBreaker.
      protected AtomicLong openCount
      How many times the breaker has tripped during its lifetime.
      protected AtomicLong resetMillis
      How long the cooldown period is in milliseconds.
      protected CircuitBreaker.BreakerState state
      Current state of the breaker.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CircuitBreaker()
      Creates a CircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
      CircuitBreaker(FailureInterpreter fi)
      Creates a CircuitBreaker with the specified FailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
      CircuitBreaker(String name)
      Creates a CircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
      CircuitBreaker(String name, CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception> mapper)
      Creates a CircuitBreaker with a DefaultFailureInterpreter and using the supplied CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper when client calls are made while the breaker is tripped.
      CircuitBreaker(String name, FailureInterpreter fi)
      Creates a CircuitBreaker with the specified FailureInterpreter and the default "tripped" exception behavior (throwing a CircuitBreakerException).
      CircuitBreaker(String name, FailureInterpreter fi, CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper<? extends Exception> mapper)
      Creates a CircuitBreaker with the provided FailureInterpreter and using the provided CircuitBreakerExceptionMapper when client calls are made while the breaker is tripped.

        public <V> V invoke(Callable<V> c)
             throws Exception
        Wrap the given service call with the CircuitBreaker protection logic.
        Specified by:

        Type Parameters:
        V - The callable type I am wrapping
        Parameters:
        c - the Callable to attempt
        Returns:
        whatever c would return on success
        Throws:
        CircuitBreakerException - if the breaker was OPEN or HALF_CLOSED and this attempt wasn't the reset attempt
        Exception - if c throws one during execution

      • setByPassState

        public void setByPassState(boolean b)
        When called with true - causes the CircuitBreaker to byPass its functionality allowing requests to be executed unmolested until the CircuitBreaker is reset or the byPass is manually set to false.
        Parameters:
        b - Set this breaker into bypass mode

      • getByPassState

        public boolean getByPassState()
        Get the current state of the CircuitBreaker byPass
        Returns:
        boolean the byPass flag's current value

      • trip

        public void trip()
        Causes the CircuitBreaker to trip and OPEN; no new requests will be allowed until the CircuitBreaker resets.

      • tripHard

        public void tripHard()
        Manually trips the CircuitBreaker until reset() is invoked.

      • getLastTripTime

        public long getLastTripTime()
        Returns the last time the breaker tripped OPEN, measured in milliseconds since the Epoch.
        Returns:
        long the last failure time

      • getTripCount

        public long getTripCount()
        Returns the number of times the breaker has tripped OPEN during its lifetime.
        Returns:
        long the number of times the circuit breaker tripped

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Manually set the breaker to be reset and ready for use. This is only useful after a manual trip otherwise the breaker will trip automatically again if the service is still unavailable. Just like a real breaker. WOOT!!!

      • getStatus

        public Status getStatus()
        Returns the current Status of the CircuitBreaker. In this case, it really refers to the status of the client service. If the CircuitBreaker is CLOSED, we report that the client is UP; if it is HALF_CLOSED, we report that the client is DEGRADED; if it is OPEN, we report the client is DOWN.
        Returns:
        Status the current status of the breaker

      • getServiceStatus

        public ServiceStatus getServiceStatus()
        Get the current ServiceStatus of the CircuitBreaker, including the name, Status, and reason.
        Specified by:
        getServiceStatus in interface MonitoredService
        Returns:
        the ServiceStatus.

      • getResetMillis

        public long getResetMillis()
        Returns the cooldown period in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        long

      • setResetMillis

        public void setResetMillis(long l)
        Sets the reset period to the given number of milliseconds. The default is 15,000 (make one retry attempt every 15 seconds).
        Parameters:
        l - number of milliseconds to "cool down" after tripping before allowing a "test request" through again

      • getHealthCheck

        public String getHealthCheck()
        Returns a String representation of the breaker's status; potentially useful for exposing to monitoring software.
        Returns:
        String which is "GREEN" if the breaker is CLOSED; "YELLOW" if the breaker is HALF_CLOSED; and "RED" if the breaker is OPEN (tripped).

      • setLimit

        public void setLimit(int limit)
        Specifies the failure tolerance limit for the DefaultFailureInterpreter that comes with a CircuitBreaker by default.
        Parameters:
        limit - the number of tolerated failures in a window
        See Also:
        DefaultFailureInterpreter

      • setIgnore

        public void setIgnore(Collection<Class<? extends Throwable>> ignore)
        Specifies a set of Throwable classes that should not be considered failures by the CircuitBreaker.
        Parameters:
        ignore - a Collection of Throwable classes
        See Also:
        DefaultFailureInterpreter

      • setWindowMillis

        public void setWindowMillis(long windowMillis)
        Specifies the tolerance window in milliseconds for the DefaultFailureInterpreter that comes with a CircuitBreaker by default.
        Parameters:
        windowMillis - length of the window in milliseconds
        See Also:
        DefaultFailureInterpreter

      • setFailureInterpreter

        public void setFailureInterpreter(FailureInterpreter failureInterpreter)
        Specifies a helper that determines whether a given failure will cause the breaker to trip or not.
        Parameters:
        failureInterpreter - the FailureInterpreter to use

      • getFailureInterpreter

        public FailureInterpreter getFailureInterpreter()
        Get the failure interpreter for this instance. The failure interpreter provides the configuration for determining which exceptions trip the circuit breaker, in what time interval, etc.
        Returns:
        FailureInterpreter for this instance or null if no failure interpreter was set.
